get.summary: Read configuration of external captive portal
get.description:
Use this API to configure external captive portal profiles for guest users. For AP and GW, When the captive portal profile is applied to an SSID or a wired profile, the users connecting
to the SSID or wired network are assigned a role with the captive portal rule. For CX, when the client is 802.1x or MAC authenticated through RADIUS-server, the redirect parameters in this
profile can be applied through user-role, Downloadable User Role and RADIUS Vendor Specific Attribute. This feature is applicable for AP, CX and GW.

post.summary: Create a new external captive profile by unique name

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the captive portal profile.

get.summary: Read existing external captive profile configuration

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the captive portal profile.

patch.summary: Update existing external captive profile configuration

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the captive portal profile.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the captive portal profile.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaAaaCaptivePortal_CaptivePortalSchem.description:
Use this API to configure external captive portal profiles for guest users. For AP and GW, When the captive portal profile is applied to an SSID or a wired profile, the users connecting
to the SSID or wired network are assigned a role with the captive portal rule. For CX, when the client is 802.1x or MAC authenticated through RADIUS-server, the redirect parameters in this
profile can be applied through user-role, Downloadable User Role and RADIUS Vendor Specific Attribute. This feature is applicable for AP, CX and GW.

name.description: The name of the captive portal profile.

description.description: Description, or comment, for the Captive Portal profile.

external-cp-server-url.description: The URL for the external captive portal server, URL format:http(s)://<server>:<port>/path.

use-https.description: Enforce clients to use HTTPS to communicate with the authentication server

redirect-url.x-typeDescription:
An ASCII-encoded Uniform Resource Locator (URL) as defined
in RFC 3986, section 1.1.3
redirect-url.description: Specify a redirect URL to redirect users to another URL.

server-failthrough.description: Allow the guest clients to access Internet when the external captive portal server is not available.

server-offload.description: Enables the server-offload feature to reduce the load on the external captive portal server by allowing the Instant AP to use a Meta tag to redirect HTTP and HTTPS requests from the client.

switch-ip.description: Sends the IP address of the virtual controller in the redirection URL when external captive portal servers are used.

prevent-frame-overlay.description: When the Prevent frame overlay option is enabled, a frame can display a page only if it is in the same domain as the main page.

out-of-service-page.description: Configures a URL to redirect the users when the internet uplink is down.

redirect-pause.description: Pause time for automatic redirect.Range: 1-60, 0 to disable. Default: 10.

logout-popup-window.description: Open popup window for logout after authentication.

logon-wait-min-delay.description: Logon wait when CPU is overloaded, minimum wait (secs).

logon-wait-max-delay.description: Logon wait when CPU is overloaded,Maximum wait (secs).

logon-wait-cpu-threshold.description: Logon wait when CPU is overloaded, CPU utilization threshold (%). Range: 1-100. Default: 60.

max-authentication-failures.description: Maximum auth failures before user is added to denylist.Range: 0-10. Default: 0.

show-fqdn.description: Allow user to see and select FQDN.

welcome-page.description: Alternate welcome page to show after authentication.

enable-welcome-page.description: Enable the welcome page before redirection to original destination.

user-vlan-in-redirection-url.description: Add user VLAN in redirection URL.

ap-mac-in-redirection-url.description: Add AP's MAC address in redirection URL.

single-session.description: Allow only one active user session at a time.

ip-addr-in-redirection-url.description: Add one of the controller interfaces in the redirection URL.

show-acceptable-use-policy.description: Show the acceptable use policy page before the logon page.

user-idle-timeout.x-typeDescription: User idle timeout for Captive Portal in seconds. Valid range is 30-1296000 seconds in multiples of 30 seconds.
user-idle-timeout.description: User idle timeout value. Valid range is 30-1296000 seconds in multiples of 30 seconds

apple-cna-bypass.description: To bypass Apple CNA on iOS devices like iPad, iPhone, iPod.

url-hash-key-value.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
url-hash-key-value.description: Hash the redirection URL using this key.

url-hash-key-ciphertext-value.description: Hash the redirection URL using this key in ciphertext format.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.
